qas.question: How did the people  know that Alexander had chosen Athanasius as his successor?
How old was Athanasius when he was chosen as Patriarch?
Who came to Alexandria to confirm the choice?
Did all the people want him as Patriarch?
How long after the Council of Nicae did Alexander die?
How did the people know that Alexander had chosen Athanasius as his predecesor?
How old was Athanasius when he was chosen as Pope?
How long after the Council of Nicae was Alexander born?

context: Alban Butler, writes on the subject: "<a4_0><b7_0>Five months<b7_0/><a4_0/> after this great Council, Nicae, St Alexander lying on his death-bed, recommended to his clergy and people the choice of Athanasius for his successor, <a0_0><b5_0>thrice repeating his name<b5_0/><a0_0/>. In consequence of his recommendation, the <a2_0>bishops of all Egypt<a2_0/> assembled at Alexandria, and finding the people and clergy <a3_0>unanimous in their choice<a3_0/> of Athanasius for patriarch, they confirmed the election about the middle of year 326. He seems, then, to have been about <a1_0><b6_0>thirty years<b6_0/><a1_0/> of age. "
